channel.title: Linux Cranks Podcast (ogg)
channel.description: The Linux Cranks Podcast is a live show that airs almost every Saturday night at 11pm CST. Comments, contacts, feeds, and show notes can be found on the blog and forum. Warning: This show contains foul language, nudity, and heavy drinking. If your easily offended or have no sense of humor, please do not listen. Hosts: threethirty, monsterb, Peter64, klaatu, chad_w, xoke, and many others get cranky.
channel.itunes:author: monsterb
channel.itunes:subtitle: Linux Cranks
channel.itunes:summary: The Linux Cranks Podcast is a live show that airs almost every Saturday night at 11pm CST. Comments, contacts, feeds, and show notes can be found on the blog and forum. Warning: This show contains foul language, nudity, and heavy drinking. If your easily offended or have no sense of humor, please do not listen. Hosts: threethirty, monsterb, Peter64, klaatu, chad_w, xoke, and many others get cranky. Home: http://linuxcranks.info

item.title: Linux Cranks 3x11 ogg - Savory Biscuits
item.description: The Cranks talk about Project Kenai, Microsoft Ad, Bill Gates, Jerry Seinfeld, Vegemite, Ohio Linux Fest, Food, and many other random topics. Also the aftershow is included for your listening pleasure. Cranks this week: monsterb, 330, Peter64, klaatu, jlindsay, Azimuth, Xoke, Jack Johnson, Barry Williams, UberChick, and Timrit.
item.author: monsterb@linuxcranks.info (monsterb)

item.title: Linux Cranks 3x05 - ogg - Linux Has Better Porn
item.description: We talk about a fake Linux event called Monsterpalooza 2008, selling free software like OpenOffice.org, why Intel chooses Fedora over Ubuntu and many more cranky topics.
item.author: monsterb@linuxcranks.info (monsterb)
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk about a fake Linux event called Monsterpalooza 2008, selling free software like OpenOffice.org, why Intel chooses Fedora over Ubuntu and many more cranky topics.

item.title: Linux Cranks 3x03 ogg - We use Linux on everything that matters!
item.description: Merlin starts the show off with a warning. We talk about free software, open source and Best Buy selling Ubuntu for $20 with 60 days of phone support and a few other random topics.
